results.title: Desert farming
results.creator_credit: Arthur G. Evans, Lou Lilly, Quartet Films and West
results.brief_description: Describes the conservation approaches and the modern technology used by scientists to convert deserts into blooming farmlands; how we have learned to bring water for irrigation, leech the soil of unwanted chemicals, and provide proper drainage. Shows machinery used, crops grown, harvesting and packaging.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur G. Evans, Lou Lilly, Quartet Films and West

results.title: Desert Conquest
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: The story of how the Australian Mutual Provident Society, by a scheme of mass clearing and scientific development transformed over a quarter of a million acres of desert land in South Australia into rich pasture holdings. Shows how the land was cleared and how the men and their families who worked on this project eventually settled on the reclaimed soil on farms of their own.

results.title: Desert cargo
results.creator_credit: A Vickers, Leslie Sansom, British Information Services and Vickers Films
results.brief_description: For the transportation of liquefied natural gas from Algeria to Britain the engineers of Vickers shipbuilding undertake at the Barrow Shipyard the building of a highly specialised tanker. The initial research, construction and testing that led up to the launching of the “Methane Princess” are set against the background of the scheme to bring a new source of energy to Britain and pioneer a new world industry

results.title: Desert Air Force
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, Kenneth Rick and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War in the Air”.
The air defence of the Middle East from Italy’s‘ entry into the war in Summer 1940 to the establishment of an advance wing of the Desert Air Force in Tripoli at the end of 1942.

results.title: The Desert
results.creator_credit: Michael Birch and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the desert biome; its geographical locations, the causes of its formation, its temperature conditions and consequent aridity; its dust storms, and its rains. Shows the diversity of the plants and animals of the desert and how they adapt to their arid environment.

results.title: The Dermis probe
results.creator_credit: Institute of Comparative Dermatography and Richard Williams Films
results.brief_description: Philosophical, scientific voices intone the marvels beyond man’s comprehension, to the accompaniment of dreamy, highly coloured images and sounds. Until, finally the camera pulls back to reveal the subject of the symposium. This parody of the jargon and the relentless close-ups of didactic scientific films is actually a parable of an 800 year old story: “Elephant in the Dark” a little fable about people who feel different parts of an elephant, all believing that what they feel is the whole beast. A serious yet entertaining look at the impediments in current thought which prevent certain forms of understanding between people. Written by Idries Shah
results.creator_credit_for_label: Institute of Comparative Dermatography and Richard Williams Films

results.title: Dermatitis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety”.
Dermatitis is a problem in many industries. This film shows how dermatitis is caused and how it can be avoided. Dermatitis in the home is also briefly discussed.

results.title: The Depths of space: exterior galaxies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Universe”.
The 200-inch telescope of Palomar Observatory reveals, to the limit of its two billion light year range, a universe strewn with other milky ways or galaxies like our own, with misty objects faintly visible which indicate that there are other galaxies lying beyond even that vast distance.

results.title: Blahs, blues and better days
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck, Paul Cowan, American Educational Films and Directions Unlimited Films
results.brief_description: Explores the gamut between blues and depression. Differentiates between normal and abnormal reactions to crisis and shows us how to recognise danger signs. In depth case studies of three young people are carried out as two of them seek help and one does not. Others have an opportunity to ask questions about their emotional ups and downs. Dr Marvin Karno of the UCLA Neuro-psychiatric Institute appears as a counsellor to offer authentic doctor/patient experience. Commentary by Joseph Campanella.
